description: Adapted from CIM and https://github.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.EnergyCIM/tree/master/PowerTransformer data models: A wire or combination of wires, with consistent electrical characteristics, building a single electrical system, used to carry alternating current between points in the power system. For symmetrical, transposed 3ph lines, it is sufficient to use  attributes of the line segment, which describe impedances and admittances for the entire length of the segment.  Additionally impedances can be computed by using length and associated per length impedances. The BaseVoltage at the two ends of ACLineSegments in a Line shall have the same BaseVoltage.nominalVoltage. However, boundary lines  may have slightly different BaseVoltage.nominalVoltages and  variation is allowed. Larger voltage difference in general requires use of an equivalent branch.

contents.name: ConductorBch
contents.description: Positive sequence shunt (charging) susceptance, uniformly distributed, of the entire line section.  This value represents the full charging over the full length of the line. Default: 0.0

contents.name: ConductorR
contents.description: The positive sequence series resistance of the entire line section.

contents.name: ConductorX
contents.description: The positive sequence series reactance of the entire line section.

contents.name: ConductorType
contents.description: The conductor type the line Segment.

contents.name: SegmentSequenceNumber
contents.description: It reflects a precise order using sequence number.

contents.name: Location
contents.description: The location of the instance of LineSegment
